uiDefinition.description: The API Key for this api

properties.description: This is the PaloAlto Custom Connector

get.description: Quert XML API for PCAPs and Device Info

metadata.comments: This PaloAlto custom connector uses PAN-OS API to perform different actions on the PAN-OS VM

metadata.description: Name of the Logic App/Playbook
Name of the custom connector which interacts with PAN-OS
Name of the cLog Analytics Resource group for logging
Name of the Log Analytics instance for logging

metadata.title: Get System Info - Palo Alto PAN-OS XML API
metadata.description: This playbook allows us to get System Info of a Palo Alto device for a Sentinel alert.
mainSteps:
When a new Sentinel incident is created, this playbook gets triggered and performs below actions: 

 1. Gets the various parameters from the alert 

 2. Gets the System Info for the device in the alert. 

 3. Creates a Sentinel Incident and updates it with the system info.
prerequisites:
1. PaloAlto connector needs to be deployed prior to the deployment of this playbook under the same subscription. Relevant instructions can be found in the connector doc page. 

 2. Generate an API key.[Refer this link on how to generate the API Key](https://paloaltolactest.trafficmanager.net/restapi-doc/#tag/key-generation) 

 3. This playbook only works for Palo Alto incidents.
metadata.postDeployment:
** a. Authorize connections ** Once deployment is complete, you will need to authorize each connection. 

 1. Click the Microsoft Sentinel connection resource 

 2. Click edit API connection 

 3. Click Authorize 

 4. Sign in 

 5. Click Save 

 6. Repeat steps for other connections such as Blob Store connection and PAN-OS API connection (For authorizing the PAN-OS API connection, API Key needs to be provided) 

 ** b. Configurations in Sentinel ** 1. In Microsoft sentinel analytical rules should be configured to trigger an incident with risky IP 

 2. Configure the automation rules to trigger this playbook

releaseNotes.title: Get System Info - Palo Alto PAN-OS XML API

metadata.description: Name of the Logic App/Playbook
Name of the custom connector which interacts with PAN-OS
Name of the cLog Analytics Resource group for logging
Name of the log analytics instance for logging

metadata.title: Get Threat PCAP - Palo Alto PAN-OS XML API
metadata.description: This playbook allows us to get a threat PCAP for a given PCAP ID.
mainSteps:
When a new Sentinel incident is created, this playbook gets triggered and performs below actions: 

 1. Gets the various parameters from the alert 

 2. Gets the PCAP from the device. 

 3. Puts the PCAP in Blob Storage 

 4. Creates a Sentinel Incident and updates it with a link to the blob.
prerequisites:
1. PaloAlto connector needs to be deployed prior to the deployment of this playbook under the same subscription. Relevant instructions can be found in the connector doc page. 

 2. Generate an API key.[Refer this link on how to generate the API Key](https://paloaltolactest.trafficmanager.net/restapi-doc/#tag/key-generation) 

 3. This playbook only works for Palo Alto incidents with a threat PCAP where the PCAP ID is not null or zero.
metadata.postDeployment:
** a. Authorize connections ** Once deployment is complete, you will need to authorize each connection. 

 1. Click the Microsoft Sentinel connection resource 

 2. Click edit API connection 

 3. Click Authorize 

 4. Sign in 

 5. Click Save 

 6. Repeat steps for other connections such as Blob Store connection and PAN-OS API connection (For authorizing the PAN-OS API connection, API Key needs to be provided) 

 ** b. Configurations in Sentinel ** 1. In Microsoft sentinel analytical rules should be configured to trigger an incident with risky IP 

 2. Configure the automation rules to trigger this playbook

releaseNotes.title: Get Threat PCAP - Palo Alto PAN-OS XML API

metadata.description: Name of the Logic App/Playbook

body.message:
PAN-OS Playbook has collected the following information :

Got List of address objects and also got URL filtering category Information:

Details of address objects:

name :  @{outputs('Compose_body_of_address_object')?['@name']}
location :  @{outputs('Compose_body_of_address_object')?['@location']}
vsys :  @{outputs('Compose_body_of_address_object')?['@vsys']}
description :  @{outputs('Compose_body_of_address_object')?['description']}
fqdn :  @{outputs('Compose_body_of_address_object')?['fqdn']}

Details of URL filtering category information:

@{body('Create_HTML_table_for_URL_category_information')}

Compose_body_of_address_object.description: This composes the body of address object where URL is a member

Create_HTML_table_for_URL_category_infor.description: This creates HTML table for the URL filtering category information

Filter_URL_from_list_of_address_objects.description: This filters the URL from the list of address objects

List_address_objects.description: This Lists all the address objects present in the PAN-OS

metadata.comments: This playbook uses the PaloAlto connector to automatically enrich incidents generated by Sentinel for address object details and URL filtering category information from PAN-OS
metadata.title: PaloAlto-PAN-OS-GetURLCategoryInfo
metadata.description: When a new sentinal incident is created, this playbook gets triggered and performs below actions:
mainSteps:
1. Fetches the address group details and URL filtering category information from PAN-OS 

 2. Updates all the collected information in incident 

 ![PaloAlto-PAN-OS-GetURLCategoryInfo](./designerscreenshot.PNG)
prerequisites:
1. PAN-OS Custom Connector needs to be deployed prior to the deployment of this playbook under the same subscription. 

 2. Generate an API key. [Refer this link on how to generate the API Key](https://paloaltolactest.trafficmanager.net/restapi-doc/#tag/key-generation)
metadata.postDeployment:
** a. Authorize connections ** Once deployment is complete, you will need to authorize each connection. 

 1. Click the Microsoft Sentinel connection resource 

 2. Click edit API connection 

 3. Click Authorize 

 4. Sign in 

 5. Click Save 

 6. Repeat steps for PAN-OS API Connection (For authorizing the PAN-OS API connection, API Key needs to be provided) 

 ** b. Configurations in Sentinel ** 1. In Microsoft sentinel analytical rules should be configured to trigger an incident with risky user account 

 2. Configure the automation rules to trigger this playbook

body.message:
PAN-OS Playbook ran and performed the following actions:
@{variables('IPAddressAction')}



Actions taken on Sentinel : Add comment to incident and closure with classification reason  @{body('Post_an_Adaptive_Card_to_a_Teams_channel_and_wait_for_a_response')['data']['incidentStatus']}

Condition_based_on_the_incident_configur.description: This decides the action taken on the summarized adaptive card

Create_an_address_object.description: This creates a new address object for the malicious IP

equals: Block IP ( add to @{outputs('Configured_address_group')} address group )

Condition__to_check_if_user_chosen_Block.description: This check if user chooses Block IP

inputs.name: IPAddressAction
inputs.value:
IP Address : @{items('For_each_malicious_IP')?['Address']} ,  Action Taken :  Blocked  by               
                       adding to @{outputs('Configured_address_group')}  ,  Status  :  Success

Append_success_status_Blocked_IP_status_.description: append action taken to summarize on the adaptive card

inputs.name: IPAddressAction
inputs.value:
IP Address : @{items('For_each_malicious_IP')?['Address']} ,  Action Taken :  UnBlocked  by      
                                  removing from @{outputs('Configured_address_group')}  ,  Status  :  Success

Append_success_status_UnBlocked_IP_statu.description: append action taken to summarize on the adaptive card

equals: Block IP ( add to @{outputs('Configured_address_group')} address group )

inputs.name: IPAddressAction
inputs.value: IP Address : @{items('For_each_malicious_IP')?['Address']} ,  Action Taken :  @{body('Post_an_Adaptive_Card_to_a_Teams_channel_and_wait_for_a_response_3')['submitActionId']} ,  Status         :  Failure

Append_failure_status_to_summary_card.description: append action taken to summarize on the adaptive card

inputs.name: IPAddressAction
inputs.value: IP Address : @{items('For_each_malicious_IP')?['Address']} ,  Action Taken :  @{body('Post_an_Adaptive_Card_to_a_Teams_channel_and_wait_for_a_response_3')['submitActionId']} ,  Status :  Success

Append_to_array_variable_Ip_address_acti.description: This appends the action taken on IP to the list of existing actions

Condition_based_on_user_inputs_from_the_.description: condition to check the submit action is block / unblock or Ignore

value.text: The IP  @{items('For_each_malicious_IP')?['Address']} is already a member of the blocked address group @{outputs('Configured_address_group')}

Append_address_group_text.description: append address group text to adaptive card dynamically

Filter_array_IP_address_from_the_list_of.description: This filters the IP address from predefined address group to unreference/unblock IP

Set_dynamic_action_name.description: variable to set action name dynamically

unreference_IP_address_from_the_existing.description: unreference IP address from the group members and update

Append_IP_address_to_the_address_group_m.description: append IP address to the address group members

value.text: The IP  @{items('For_each_malicious_IP')?['Address']} is not a member of the blocked address group @{outputs('Configured_address_group')}

Append_address_group_text_to_adaptive_ca.description: append address group text to adaptive card dynamically

Condition_to_check_if_Ip_already_present.description: condition to check the malicious IP address is present in the predefined address group and the IP is part of static member

Append_IP_to_array_of_address_group_memb.description: append the Malicious IP address to the existing group members to block / unblock from the predefined address group

value.text: The IP  @{items('For_each_malicious_IP')?['Address']} is not a member of the blocked address group @{outputs('Configured_address_group')}

Append_to_array_variable_text_if_IP_is_n.description: This appends the text to display If Ip is not a member of security policy rules

Set_variable_to_Block_Ip.description: This sets the variable block IP

Condition_to_check_if_Ip_address_already.description: This checks if Ip is a member of any of the list of address objects

value.text: It is also member of the following security policy rules

Append_policy_text.description: dynamic policy text based on security policies

Append_security_policies.description: append security policies which the IP address is exist

value.text: It is not a member of any other Policy Rules

Append_policy_text_to_adaptive_card_body.description: dynamic policy text based on security policies

Append_security_policies_to_adaptive_car.description: append security policies which the IP address is exist

Condition_to_check_if_the_IP_is_a_part_o.description: condition to check if the IP address is present in the existing security policy rules to conditionally apply the policy text and security policy rules

Filter_array_Ip_from_list_of_security_ru.description: This filters all the security rules in which this Ip is a member

Filter_array_of_Ip_address_from_list_of_.description: This filters the list of address objects in which this Ip is a member

List_address_groups.description: This gets complete list of address object groups present in the PAN-OS

Select_security_policy_rules.description: prepare columns list to show the security policy rules in the adaptive card if IP address is present

value.text: Possible Comprised IP @{items('For_each_malicious_IP')?['Address']} detected by the provider  :  @{outputs('Compose_product_name')}

Set_variable_adaptive_card_body.description: variable to hold adaptive card body

Set_variable_address_group_members.description: assign list of address group members

Initialize_variable_IP_address_action.description: This holds the action taken on each IP

Initialize_variable_action_name.description: variable to store action name to be displayed on adaptive card

Initialize_variable_adaptive_card_body.description: variable to store adaptive card body json

Initialize_variable_address_group_member.description: variable to store the list of address group members

List_address_objects.description: This gets complete list of address object present in the PAN-OS

List_security_rules.description: This gets complete list of security policy rules present in the PAN-OS

Select_alert_product_names.description: data operator to select the alert product name

Set_variable_actions_on_IP_to_be_display.description: This is used to compose the list of actions taken by SOC on respective IP addresses

metadata.comments: This playbook uses the PaloAlto connector to take necessary actions on IP address like Block IP/Unblock IP from predefined address group and also gives an option to close the incident.
metadata.title: PaloAlto-PAN-OS-BlockIP
metadata.description: This playbook allows blocking/unblocking IPs in PaloAlto, using **Address Object Groups**. This allows to make changes on predefined address group, which is attached to predefined security policy rule.
mainSteps:
When a new Sentinel incident is created, this playbook gets triggered and performs below actions: 

 1. An adaptive card is sent to the SOC channel providing Incident information, IP address, list of existing security policy rules in which IP is a member of and provides an option to Block/Unblock IP Address to predefined address group or Ignore. 

 2. The SOC can take action on risky IP based on the information provided in the adaptive card. 

 ![PaloAlto-PAN-OS-BlockIP](./designerscreenshot.PNG) 

 **This is the adaptive card SOC will receive when playbook is triggered for each risky IP for taking actions like block/unblock/ignore:** 

 ![Adaptive Card example](./AdaptiveCardtoBlockorUnblock.PNG) 

 **This is the consolidate adaptive card about the summary of actions taken on IP and the incident configuration:** 

 ![Consolidated Adaptive Card example](./SummarizedAdaptiveCard.PNG)
prerequisites:
1. PaloAlto connector needs to be deployed prior to the deployment of this playbook under the same subscription. Relevant instructions can be found in the connector doc page. 

 2. Generate an API key. [Refer this link on how to generate the API Key](https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/10-1/pan-os-panorama-api/get-started-with-the-pan-os-xml-api/get-your-api-key) 

 3. Address group should be created for PAN-OS and this should be used while creating playbooks.
postDeployment:
**a. Authorize connections** 

 Once deployment is complete, you will need to authorize each connection. 

 1. Click the Microsoft Sentinel connection resource 

 2. Click edit API connection 

 3. Click Authorize 

 4. Sign in 

 5. Click Save 

 6. Repeat steps for other connection such as Teams connection and PAN-OS API connection (For authorizing the PAN-OS API connection, API Key needs to be provided) 

 **b. Configurations in Sentinel** 

 1. In Microsoft sentinel analytical rules should be configured to trigger an incident with risky IP 

 2. Configure the automation rules to trigger this playbook

metadata.comments: This playbook uses the PaloAlto connector to take necessary actions on URL address like Block URL/Unblock URL from predefined address group and also gives an option to close the incident.
metadata.title: PaloAlto-PAN-OS-BlockURL
metadata.description: This playbook allows blocking/unblocking URLs in PaloAlto, using **predefined address group**. This allows to make changes on predefined address group, which is attached to security policy rule.
prerequisites:
1. PaloAlto connector needs to be deployed prior to the deployment of this playbook under the same subscription. Relevant instructions can be found in the connector doc page. 

 2. Generate an API key.[Refer this link on how to generate the API Key](https://paloaltolactest.trafficmanager.net/restapi-doc/#tag/key-generation) 

 3. Address group should be created for PAN-OS and this should be used while creating playbooks.
mainSteps:
When a new Sentinel incident is created, this playbook gets triggered and performs below actions: 

 1. An adaptive card is sent to the SOC channel providing Incident information, URL address, list of existing security policy rules in which URL is a member of and provides an option to Block/Unblock URL Address by adding/removing it to/from the predefined address group. 

 2. The SOC can act on risky URL based on the information provided in the adaptive card, or ignore. 

 ![PaloAlto-PAN-OS-BlockURL](./designerScreenshot.PNG) 

 **This is the adaptive card SOC will receive when playbook is triggered for each risky URL for taking actions like block/unblock/ignore ::** 

 ![Adaptive Card example](./AdaptiveCardtoBlockorUnblock.PNG) 

 **This is the consolidate adaptive card about the summary of actions taken on URL and the incident configuration ::** 

 ![Consolidated Adaptive Card example](./SummarizedAdaptiveCard.PNG)
postDeployment:
**a. Authorize connections** 

 Once deployment is complete, you will need to authorize each connection. 

 1. Click the Microsoft Sentinel connection resource 

 2. Click edit API connection 

 3. Click Authorize 

 4. Sign in 

 5. Click Save 

 6. Repeat steps for other connection such as Teams connection and PAN-OS API connection (For authorizing the PAN-OS API connection, API Key needs to be provided) 

 **b. Configurations in Sentinel** 

 1. In Microsoft sentinel analytical rules should be configured to trigger an incident with risky URL 

 2. Configure the automation rules to trigger this playbook
